site_title: Manta Jet by Michael G. LaFosse

block_list.title: Video Tutorial
block_list.body: This plane is model after an extremely cool fish, the Manta Ray. This is the Manta Jet designed by Michael G. LaFosse. Due to the complexity of the wings, you will need to adjust it a bit when flying the plane. However, it just looks really nice. This plane is another origami plane, folded from a square sheet of paper. I hope you enjoy it! If you missed my last Exotic Paper Airplane "Paper Plane 037 : Phoenix Plane by Andrew Dewar", you could watch it at https://youtu.be/PNPSHJlrH4Q Manta Jet by Michael G. LaFosse Tutorial Timeline: 0:00 Demonstration 0:12 Flight Test 0:33 Start Folding 1:05 Folding the Nose of The Paper Airplane 2:48 Folding the Horizontal Fins of the Manta Ray 4:05 Folding the Vertical Fins of the Manta Jet 4:48 Folding the Fuselage of the Manta Jet 5:17 Folding the Wings of the Manta Jet 5:55 Opening up the Manta Jet 6:23 How to Throw Thanks For Watching! Wilson Lee @Heap Art
